title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
Create a webpage
Make it well-formed
Make it stylish
Make it interactive
Make it graphical





Content!
Nesting!
Headings!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
Create a webpage
Make it well-formed
Make it stylish
Make it interactive
Make it graphical

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
Content!
Nesting!
Headings!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

HTML5 is the latest, greatest, and final version of “HTML”

Hypertext

Text for the internet

Markup

Text that describes how it should be displayed

Language

A consistent grammar for the above

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
How?

HTML Living Standard
Check it out!

Search (via Ctrl+f
Look for <head>
The first “hit” will be the most basic HTML page that is well-formed

That is, doesn’t break any rules.

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

Thus far we relied on default behavior.
Hello, world was assumed to be:

The content of
A paragraph in
The body of
A website with
No name or
Special formatting

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

We recall last time we:

Followed these instructions”

Coding Camp

Created a GitHub repository

github.com/<account>/<repository>

Worked in GitHub Codespaces

Clicked on  <> Code 🔽

Created a corresponding GitHub page:

<account>.github.io/<repository>

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
How?

I recommend having exactly these four websites open in tabs.

Read these instructions
Make changes in the Codespace
Verify them in the repository
After a few minutes, see them on the webpage

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

It is a little to easy to give up and do nothing.
That is no fun!
Check that everything works, every time.
It’s good practice!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

The part of HTML we see is the content

Usually text (like this)
Sometimes images, like below:



An image of an image of an image

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
⚠️ Caution

Usually nothing breaks if you omit the closing tag </p>
It is considered poor form because it can cause problems in more complicated cases.



index.html

<p>This will work but is sketchy.

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

Until now, we had no way to tell HTML when to start a new line.
This looked dreadful!
Now we can!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
🏆 Bonus!

You don’t only have to use <p>, of course!
The next most common are headings - <h1> is the biggest.
Try giving your webpage a heading perhaps saying it’s mine.



index.html

<h1>My Rad Page 🏍️</h1>

<p>I have interesting thoughts to share!</p>

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

We can include one kind of HTML content in another kind of HTML content.
I term this “nesting”

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

This sort of nesting is a natural way to arrange information.

Letters in words.
Words in sentences.
Sentences in paragraphs.
Paragraphs in essays.
Etc.

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
⚠️ Caution

We can nest but not overlap.
Consider the example using bold and italics
Try this:



bad

<p>This is <em>very <strong>wrong</em>!</strong></p>


This is very wrong!


And this:



good

<p>This <em>is <strong>correct</strong>.</em></p>


This is correct.

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

Not every part of a webpage is content.
To specify just the page content, we place it within a <body>.

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
🥷 An Aside

Content is enclosed in “tags”, like <p>
Content and tag is called an element.




Thing
Term




Hello
Content


<p>
Tag


<p>Hello</p>
Element




Most useful to look up how to do things.

E.g. center text with the <center> tag.

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
How?

We’ll use a new element - <body>
We’ll buy everything so far inside it.

For me, this meant indenting everything again.

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

This doesn’t do anything yet.
But will allow us to add headers:

Ways to change how the page is understood…

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

Take a look at either the:

Name of the window you are looking at, or
Name of the tab you are looking at

It is probably “Coding Camp - 🌐 HTML!”

How did that get there?

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

Less important than it used to be, though still looks sharp.
Historically important for search engines!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

In the very early days there were (maybe?) formats other than HTML.
I don’t know what they would be!
But there were at least other versions (namely 1-4)
So HTML pages should specify they are… HTML!

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

Makes things easier (and therefore faster) for web browsers.
Mark of professionalism.

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

Sometimes we want to leave notes to ourselves or other web developers.
We don’t need everyone visiting our page to see them.
We do this using the special “comment” element.

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

I most usually it to keep track of notes.
Many of my pages have the following:



index.html

<!-- Adapted from https://html.spec.whatwg.org/ -->

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

We have now covered all the requirements to make a well-formed HTML page!

title: 🌐 HTML!
🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

Per “indeed.com” (maybe don’t just trust them).

100+ jobs
Most around $40+/hr

🤑
Also its fun!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
What?

Make sure you sync your Codespace to your repository.
GitHub Pages will update automatically.
Show off your work!

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
How?

You can review from last time

title: 🌐 HTML!
text:
Why?

We learn by doing!
A little bit every day!

text:

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
About Me

Name

(Prof.) Calvin (Deutschbein)

Email

ckdeutschbein

Website

cd-public.github.io

Field

Hardware Security, Computer Systems

Pronouns

They/Them

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Goals

Create a webpage
Make it well-formed
Make it stylish
Make it interactive
Make it graphical

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Technologies

GitHub!

The worlds #1 online collaboration platform!

Three languages.

HTML - for text.
CSS - for style.
JavaScript - for action.

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Today

Github!
HTML!
Create a 📄 webpage

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

Create a GitHub account!

Use whatever name and password you want…

But make sure you remember them!

I really recommend using your .edu email address!

You get extra goodies!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

Creating an account on GitHub
Or:

Go to GitHub.com
Enter your email.
Click Sign up for GitHub
Follow the steps!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?

GitHub is a great tool for:

Learning new technologies.
Sharing your projects.
Working on projects together.
Creating websites or portfolios.

I wish I’d learned about it sooner!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

Create a GitHub repository!

Repositories are how GitHub stores the information in a website
Use whatever name you want…

But make sure you remember it!

(Someday) it will live at:

<account name>.github.io/<repository name>
Check out cd-example.github.io/bug-free-sniffle/

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

Quickstart for repositories
Or:

Go to GitHub.com

It should look different now that you’re logged in!

Click  New

Give it a name
Add a README file
Click Create Repositry

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?



Store files that make up a webpage:

“HTML” page “content”.
“CSS” page “formatting”.
“JS” (JavaScript) “interactivity”.
We can use images, like PNGs or SVGs.





An image

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

Open a GitHub codespace!

Online code editor

Google Docs for code.

Has a lot of options.

We won’t use most of them.
There’s plenty of room to grow!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

Creating a codespace for a repository
Or:

On the page for the respository you created…

github.com/<account name>/<repository name>

Click  <> Code 🔽
Click the “Codespaces” tab.
Click Create codespace on main
A new window will open… slowly.

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?

Edit files that make up a webpages:

“HTML” page “content”.

We’ll do this one first!
It is the foundation of all webpages!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

Now: The first achievement when coding!
“Hello, world!”
Within GitHub codespaces, create a new file.

It must be called index.html
HTML for “hypertext markup language”
The language of the internet!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

On the left side of the screen, ensure “Explorer” is opened.
Two overlapping files 
A bar will pop out and at the top there will be a few icons.

Click the file with a + on it.
If missing, “mouseover” repository name!

Type index.html as the name and press enter.
A new file will open up, type “Hello, world!”

title: 📄 Webpages!
text: 👀 Visually

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?

We want to be able to determine what appears on our webpage.
For now, it matters less what we change than that we can change the content.
We’ll learn more soon!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

We need changes made in codespaces to become changes in the repository.

You may wonder why this isn’t automatic: I’m not sure!

To do so we will change from the “Explorer” activity to the “Source Control” activity

It’s the technical term for “keeping track of code”

Lots of paperwork!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

Click the 
Click  ✓ Commit 

I get a box pop-up and say Always

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
🚨 Alert!

This pops up :



COMMIT_EDITMSG


# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting
# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.
#
# On branch main
# Your branch is up to date with 'origin/main'.
#
# Changes to be committed:
#   new file:   index.html
#







Caution


We must name our changes.

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
🤝 Resolve

Add any message to the first line:



COMMIT_EDITMSG

Hi it's me :)
### Please enter...


Click the ✓ on the top right.
Click  Sync Changes 1 ↑ 
Now go back to the repository page.

There should now be an index.html there!
You may need to refresh/reload.

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?

We don’t want just anyone or anything publish to a website we administer.

Spam, broken links, stale memes, etc.
Mostly GitHub doesn’t want that and won’t leave it up to us!

This process requires every change to be intentional.

I would rather it be easier, but that’s okay!
It gets better every year!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

Let’s take index.html and make it a webpage!
We’ll use “GitHub Pages”

Not too hard to set up…
I use it a lot for fun 😬

You’ll be able to show anything you do to friends and family!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

Creating a GitHub Pages site
Or:

Back on the repository page… - <account name>.github.io/<repository name>
We’ll change repository settings.

On the top, click on  Settings
On the left, click on  Pages
In the middle, under branch, change “None” to “Main” via the drop-down menu.

title: 📄 Webpages!
text: 👀 Visually

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?

We get to examine what we did!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
What?

Check our work.
Learn how to see where updates will show up.

A few minutes after “Commit+Sync”

Tell ourselves we did a good job!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
How?

<account name>.github.io/<repository name>
Or:

Back to <> Code
Bottom right, under “Deployments”, click github-pages
There will be a link on this page under the heading github-pages

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Why?

There’s many ways to publish online but this is…

Free.
Relatively quick (minutes, not hours).
Powerful enough for interactive, public webpages.

It also builds a lot of valuable skills!

title: 📄 Webpages!
text:
Today

Github!
HTML!
Create a 📄 webpage
